H0.text: Fossils are most likely to form when a rock weathers and breaks into small pieces, as George learns in his study of erosion where he studies how rocks break apart over time.

H1.text: Crystals are the most likely form that forms when a rock weathers and breaks into small pieces, as George studies erosion and learns how rocks break apart over time.

H2.text: Minerals are the most likely to form when a rock weathered by erosion breaks into small pieces, as George learns about erosion.

H3.text: Sediments are the most likely to form when a rock weathers and breaks into small pieces during erosion, as George learns.

A4.text: It occurs naturally and, through the processes of weathering and erosion, is broken down and subsequently transported by the action of wind, water, or ice or by the force of gravity acting on the particles.

A5.text: Deposited sediments are the source of sedimentary rocks, which can contain fossils of the inhabitants of the body of water that were, upon death, covered by accumulating sediment.
